page.title: 03LITTLE LANGLEYS, Steep
page.content: This wonderful Edwardian House with garden is self sufficient and has been owned by the{Jenkins}family for 3 years.Every year the gardens are opened to the public.They consist of lawn,woodland,herbacious and shrub boarders.The original garden was started by Lord Spencer Churchill . They have 1 full time staff.Seven acres out of the 156 owned are garden. The rest is used for crops (Veg),bees and sheep. The fee to look round the garden is 5op for adults, 15p for children.All this money goes to charities for Gardeners and Nurses who get in free. The breed of sheep is Texile_Dutch. They have had 48 lambs this year including 10 shearlings, 29 mothers and 1 ram. Recently a barn was built for the mothering sheep.The garden was shown on BBC TV in 1985.
